metadata.title: CVE-2018-1000168 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
nghttp2 version >= 1.10.0 and nghttp2 <= v1.31.0 contains an Improper InputValidation CWE-20 vulnerability in ALTSVC frame handling that can result insegmentation fault leading to denial of service. This attack appears to beexploitable via network client. This vulnerability appears to have beenfixed in >= 1.31.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000168` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnghttp2-14 - 1.30.0-1ubuntu1
nghttp2 - 1.30.0-1ubuntu1
nghttp2-client - 1.30.0-1ubuntu1
nghttp2-proxy - 1.30.0-1ubuntu1
nghttp2-server - 1.30.0-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nghttp2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.30.0-1ubuntu1').
